headline.main: World Briefing | Asia: Sri Lanka: Government Rejects Rebel Request

lead_paragraph: The government -- which may or may not survive Dec. 5 national elections -- said it would refuse the demand of the Tamil rebel leader, Velupillai Prabhakaran, to lift the ban on his group, the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam, before peace talks could begin. Mangala Samaraweera, an adviser to President Chandrika Kumaratunga, called Mr. Prabhakaran ''a megalomaniac, a cheap third-grade terrorist who wants to come to power and have a fascist dictatorship in the north.'' Celia W. Dugger (NYT)
abstract: Sri Lanka rejects demand of rebel leader Velupillai Prabhakaran to lift ban on his Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam before peace talks can begin (S)
